ch.aplu.tcp

Class TcpTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.aplu.tcp.TcpTools

  • public class TcpTools
extends java.lang.Object
    Declaration of some useful static helper methods.

    • Method Detail

      • splitToIntAry

        public static int[] splitToIntAry(java.lang.String s,
                  java.lang.String separator)
        Splits a line with concatenated integers separated by the given separator into single integer values.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to split. A separator may or may not end the string
        separator - the separator used in between each integer
        Returns:
        a integer array for each integer value, Integer.MIN_VALUE if the string representation could not be converted into an integer; null, if s is null or empty

      • splitToDoubleAry

        public static double[] splitToDoubleAry(java.lang.String s,
                        java.lang.String separator)
        Splits a line with concatenated doubles separated by the given separator into single integer values.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to split. A separator may or may not end the string
        separator - the separator used in between each double
        Returns:
        a integer array for each integer value, Double.MIN_VALUE if the string representation could not be converted into a double; null, if s is null or empty

      • split

        public static java.lang.String[] split(java.lang.String s,
                       java.lang.String separator)
        Splits given string with given separator string into multiple strings. Returns splitted string array (without separator).
        Returned array has length 0, if input string or separator is null or empty.
        A trailing separator is stripped.

      • stringToIntAry

        public static int[] stringToIntAry(java.lang.String s)
        Converts a string to an integer array that can be used for transmission over a TcpBridge, TcpAgent link.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to convert
        Returns:
        an integer array with the character values of the string elements

      • intAryToString

        public static java.lang.String intAryToString(int[] ary)
        Converts an integer array to a string to restore string data transmitted over a TcpBridge, TcpAgent link.
        Parameters:
        ary - the integer array with the character values of a string
        Returns:
        a string that is represented by the given array

      • intAryToString

        public static java.lang.String intAryToString(int[] ary,
                              int beginIndex)
        Converts an integer array to a string to restore string data transmitted over a TcpBridge, TcpAgent link.
        Parameters:
        ary - the integer array with the character values of a string starting at the given index
        beginIndex - the index of the the given integer array where the string representation starts
        Returns:
        a string that is represented by a part of the given array

      • intAryToString

        public static java.lang.String intAryToString(int[] ary,
                              int beginIndex,
                              int endIndex)
        Converts an integer array to a string to restore string data transmitted over a TcpBridge, TcpAgent link.
        Parameters:
        ary - the integer array with the character values of a string starting at the given index and ending at endIndex - 1
        beginIndex - the index of an element of the the given integer array where the string representation starts
        endIndex - the index of one element behind the end of the string represenation
        Returns:
        a string that is represented by a part of the given array

      • stripNickname

        public static java.lang.String stripNickname(java.lang.String nickname)
        Returns a nickname where the trailing (n) is removed. If a trailing (n) is not found, returns the unchanged nickname.
        Parameters:
        nickname - the nickname to strip
        Returns:
        the nickname without any trailing (n)

      • stripNickname

        public static java.lang.String stripNickname(java.lang.String nickname,
                             boolean zeroOnly)
        Returns a nickname where the trailing (n) is removed. If a trailing (n) is not found, returns the unchanged nickname.
        Parameters:
        nickname - the nickname to strip
        zeroOnly - if true, only (0) is stripped
        Returns:
        the nickname without any trailing (n)

      • delay

        public static void delay(long delayTime)
        Halts the current thread for the given amount of time (in ms)
        Parameters:
        delayTime - the time to sleep

      • toIntAry

        public static int[] toIntAry(long n)
        Splits the given long (64 bits) into two integers (low-order 32 bits, high-order 32 bits). Useful to split a clock time to an integer array for a bridge-agent transmission.
        Parameters:
        n - the long to split
        Returns:
        an integer array in low-order/high-order of the given long

      • toLong

        public static long toLong(int low,
          int high)
        Merges the two given integers (low-order 32 bits, high-order 32 bits) to a long (64 bits). Useful to reassemble a clock time transmitted over a bridge-agent connection.
        Parameters:
        low - the low 32-bit part of the long
        high - the high 32-bit part of the long
        Returns:
        the merged long
